person.persName: Walter C. Whitaker (Shelby Co. State Sen & General)

body.p: Shelby County, Kentucky, politician, and general. Shelby County native. Graduated from Bethany College in Bethany, Virginia. Served in the 3rd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment in the Mexican-American War from 1847 to 1848. Attended law school at Transylvania University in Lexington, Kentucky. Practiced law in Shelbyville, Kentucky. Member of the Senate of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Shelby County from 1857 to 1865. Attorney and farmer in Shelby County in 1860. Owned eleven enslaved people in Shelby County in 1860. Colonel of the 6th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment from December 24, 1861 to June 25, 1863. Brigadier General and Brevet Major General in the Army of the Cumberland from June 25, 1863 to August 24, 1865.
